Indications and doses

Oral hygiene and plaque inhibition, Oral candidiasis, Gingivitis, Management of aphthous ulcers,

By mouth using mouthwash

  • For adults
    Rinse or gargle 10 mL twice daily (rinse or gargle for about 1 minute).
  • For children
    Rinse or gargle 10 mL twice daily (rinse or gargle for about 1 minute).

Denture stomatitis,

Mouthwash

  • For adults
    Cleanse and soak dentures in mouthwash solution for 15 minutes twice daily.

Oral hygiene and plaque inhibition and gingivitis,

By mouth using dental gel

  • For adults
    Apply 1–2 times a day, to be brushed on the teeth.
  • For children
    Apply 1–2 times a day, to be brushed on the teeth.

Oral candidiasis, Management of aphthous ulcers,

By mouth using dental gel

  • For adults
    Apply 1–2 times a day, to affected areas.
  • For children
    Apply 1–2 times a day, to affected areas.

Oral hygiene and plaque inhibition, Oral candidiasis, Gingivitis, Management of aphthous ulcers,

By mouth using oromucosal spray

  • For adults
    Apply up to 12 sprays twice daily as required, to be applied tooth, gingival, or ulcer surfaces.
  • For children
    Apply up to 12 sprays twice daily as required, to be applied tooth, gingival, or ulcer surfaces.

Bladder irrigation and catheter patency solutions,

By intravesical instillation

  • For adults
    (consult product literature).

Contra indications

Known side effects

Specific side effects

notKnown: anaphylaxis, hypersensitivity, mucosal irritation, parotid gland swelling, reversible brown staining of composite restorations, reversible brown staining of silcate compositions, reversible brown staining of teeth, taste disturbance, tongue discolouration, chemical burns in preterm neonates in neonates, sensitivity,

If desquamation occurs with mucosal irritation, discontinue treatment or dilute mouthwash with an equal volume of water.

Advice for patients and carers

With oral (topical) use

Chlorhexidine gluconate may be incompatible with some ingredients in toothpaste; rinse the mouth thoroughly with water between using toothpaste and chlorhexidine-containing product.

Important safety information

With topical use

In preterm neonates, use sparingly, monitor for skin reactions, and do not allow solution to pool—risk of severe chemical burns.

Cautions regarding administration

  • With topical use: avoid contact with brain
  • With topical use: avoid contact with eyes
  • With topical use: avoid contact with meninges
  • With topical use: avoid contact with middle ear

Unlicensed use

With oral (topical) use in children

Licensed for use in children (age range not specified by manufacturer).

Corsodyl not licensed for use in children under 12 years (unless on the advice of a healthcare professional).

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Flavours of mouthwash and oral spray may include original or mint.

Profession specific information

Dental practitioners

With oral (topical) use

Corsodyl dental gel may be prescribed as Chlorhexidine Gluconate Gel; Corsodyl mouthwash may be prescribed as Chlorhexidine Mouthwash; Corsodyl oral spray may be prescribed as Chlorhexidine Oral Spray.

Prepared medicinal forms of CHLORHEXIDINE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: eye drops, liquid,
